page.title: 05 LOCAL FARMING
page.content: Around Launceston are scattered farms ranging in size from 10{acres}to 400 acres.The land is hilly so there are not vast areas of corn or other crops. Most farms are dairy,beef or sheep and a few are mixed.A typical dairy farm is Bulsworthy with 130 acres covering 15 fields.They milk about 70 Friesian cows 10 at a time in an{electrically {operated}milking parlour.Milk tankers collect the milk and take it to the Lifton Ambrosia factory for making tinned creamed rice.Spring work is {fertilising}and{rolling}grass.In Summer there is silage_making and cows {calving}in Autumn.The cows are housed indoors in Winter apart from feeding at the{silage}pit,whilst sheep are hired to crop the grass.The farmer has his own lorry transport for Launceston and Exeter markets as well as tractors and other farm machinery.
